Great to hear it this! Remember, the more we involve our children in setting rules, the more our children will be likely to follow them!

text message: What was difficult for you about establishing a rule or routine with your child or teen?
option 1: My child or teen could not agree on one specific rule or routine

name: CheckIn
text message: Amazing! Consistent rules and routines help make your child or teen feel secure. They also keep them safe!

name: CheckIn
text message: It is always important when establishing rules and routines  as a family to consider the age of each child, so you can come up with age-appropriate routines. This is most important for bedtime, time to come home/play, household chores.

name: CheckIn
text message: We should always remember that children learn best from us. The more we follow the rules, they more they will follow the rules too. You can adjust the rule to make sure that it is realistic for everyone to follow it, considering their responsibilities (for example school or work activities).

name: CheckIn
text message: When we establish rules together with our children or teens, that helps the family to understand each other better. The rules will be more realistic and our children will be more willing and able to follow the rule.

name: CheckIn
text message: When we establish rules together with our children, that helps the family to understand each other better. The rules will be more realistic and our children will be more willing and able to follow the rule.
